content.question:
Which of the following best explains why cabinet
 secretaries might not aggressively pursue the
 president’s policy agenda?

choices.label:
Cabinet secretaries are unlikely to be
 members of the president’s party.

Cabinet secretaries may develop strong
 loyalty to their departments.

Cabinet secretaries are likely to compete
 with the president in a subsequent election.

Under the Hatch Act, cabinet secretaries are
 prohibited from campaigning on behalf of
 the president.

The Freedom of Information Act compels
 cabinet secretaries to divulge confidential
 information to the media.

content.answer:
Cabinet secretaries may develop strong
 loyalty to their departments.
